form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Alexander (for himself, Mrs. Feinstein, Mrs. Shaheen, and Mr. Begich) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to prohibit voice communications through mobile communication devices on commercial passenger flights.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Commercial Flight Courtesy Act.

subsection.text: Subchapter I of chapter 417 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

Except as provided in subsection (b), an individual may not engage in voice communications through a mobile communication device while onboard an aircraft in scheduled passenger interstate or intrastate air transportation.

paragraph.text: individuals traveling on aircraft operated by a foreign carrier unless such travel is between airports located within the United States;
members of the flight crew or Federal Air Marshals who are conducting official business on behalf of the Transportation Security Administration;
